meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of the Huns.
meanings.sent1: The warrior's attire had a hunnish look to it.
meanings.sent2: Her hunnish behavior made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The cat's hunnish way of pouncing on the toy was both fierce and adorable.
meanings.sent4: The storm's hunnish rage shook the entire village.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the hunnish essence of the ancient tribe.

meanings.sent1: The dictator's actions were truly hunnish in nature.
meanings.sent2: The bandits' hunnish treatment of the villagers was appalling.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's hunnish tantrum over the toy truck caused chaos in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The hunnish competitiveness in the sports match led to intense rivalries.
meanings.sent5: The villain's hunnish laughter echoed through the dark alleyway.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the ancient Hunnic people.
meanings.sent1: The historian studied the hunnish artifacts found in the excavation site.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of hunnish relics from the past.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist's discovery shed new light on the hunnish culture.
meanings.sent4: The hunnish traditions were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The scholar's research focused on the language of the hunnish tribes.
